page.title: 18FARMING NEAR CHEPSTOW.
page.content:
Much of our area is used for agricultural purposes so we asked some of the local farmers what advantages there were in farming in this part of Wales.
The farmers said that the very fertile soil in the Chepstow area allowed great versatility for most types of arable farming and stock rearing. Also, there is very good access to markets, and the motorway system aids communications and deliveries.
Split-site farming was one of the disadvantages in this area and, although nearby urbanisation provided employees, tresspassers, vandals and motor-cyclists caused problems because they have little knowledge of country side behaviour.
